reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 149/95: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY OF MINISTER TO APPROVE AN ORDER AMENDING A PLAN OF SUBDIVISION
reg_info.reg_name_text: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY OF MINISTER TO APPROVE AN ORDER AMENDING A PLAN OF SUBDIVISION
reg_info.act_under: Planning Act   Loi sur l’aménagement du territoire

content.content:
1. (1) All authority of the Minister under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act
to give his or her consent to orders amending plans of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946 is hereby delegated to the council of each of the municipalities listed in the Schedule in respect of the land situate in the municipality.  O. Reg. 149/95, s. 1 (1). (2) The delegation is subject to the following conditions: 1. Each application received shall be assigned a separate file number. 2. If the council grants a consent, a certified copy of it shall be retained by the clerk of the municipality. 3. If any of the authority delegated in subsection (1) is in turn delegated by the council to a committee of council or an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing.  O. Reg. 149/95, s. 1 (2). (3) The delegation does not apply to an application made in respect of land in the municipality before the date set out in the Schedule beside the name of the municipality. O. Reg. 429/96, s. 1. (4) Revoked: O. Reg. 429/96, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. (1) All authority of the Minister under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act to give his or her consent to orders amending plans of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946 is hereby delegated to the council of each of the municipalities listed in the Schedule in respect of the land situate in the municipality.  O. Reg. 149/95, s. 1 (1).

(2) The delegation is subject to the following conditions:

1. Each application received shall be assigned a separate file number.

2. If the council grants a consent, a certified copy of it shall be retained by the clerk of the municipality.

3. If any of the authority delegated in subsection (1) is in turn delegated by the council to a committee of council or an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing.  O. Reg. 149/95, s. 1 (2).

(3) The delegation does not apply to an application made in respect of land in the municipality before the date set out in the Schedule beside the name of the municipality. O. Reg. 429/96, s. 1.

(4) Revoked: O. Reg. 429/96, s. 1.

content.content: 2. The delegation of authority set out in this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that a condition set out in subsection 1 (2) is not complied with.  O. Reg. 149/95, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. The delegation of authority set out in this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that a condition set out in subsection 1 (2) is not complied with.  O. Reg. 149/95, s. 2.
